content: estuary mkal socks by jacqui goulbourn difficulty level intermediate / advanced skills required cast on knit & purl working in the round cables grafting yarn 100 g solid / semi-solid 4ply / fingering weight yarn 400 yards / 366 m small size sample worked in emma s yarn practically perfect sock ice ice baby needles 2 5 mm us 1 5 needles circular or dpn or size to achieve gauge introduction gauge 8 stitches and 12 row to 1 inch 2 5 this pattern is a mystery sock to be released in 4 cm measured over stocking stitch in the round parts 1 week apart please check back each week for the next section sizes s m l finished size circumference of 8 9 10 inches 20 22 5 25 cm to fit a foot this year s theme for the solid socks group kal s circumference of 8 5 9 5 10 5 inches 22 24 is nature and the seasons the word spring can also mean the source of a river 26 5 cm in this design the geometric patterns are notions darning needle optional cable needle reminiscent of boats floating down stream to the and stitch markers river mouth sock features top down heel flap design note - symmetry and mirroring all the 3-stitch cables in this design are shown as 1/1/1 lpt as this is the motion i find easiest for my knitting style without a cable needle i know that a significant proportion of sock knitters prefer symmetrical or mirrored socks - if you want a symmetrical sock this means replacing the second 1/1/1 lpt on a given pattern line with a 1/1/1 repeat - if you d like a mirrored sock this will involve replacing all 1/1/1 lpt with 1/1/1 repeat on the second sock and also changing the direction of the central 2 stitch cable in the cuff on rounds 7 and 11 instructions please read all instructions carefully to ensure you are following the charts / instructions for the correct size part 1 cuff and upper leg part 2 lower leg and heel part 3 gusset and start of foot part 4 end of foot and toe catkitbob designs estuary032025v2 page 1 of 14 abbreviations k knit sl slip_stitch purlwise with yarn behind k tbl knit through back loop sl1yfwd slip 1 st with yarn in front of work k2tog knit 2 together sl2 k1 p2sso slip 2 sts knitwise together k1 pass 2 sl sts over p purl ssk slip 2 knitwise individually knit together through back of loops p2tog purl 2 together st s stitch es eyelet written description pass 3rd st on left ws wrong side pso2ktblyoktbl chart key hand needle over first 2 k tbl yo k tbl rs right side yo yarn over cable stitches 1/1 lt slip next stitch to cable needle and 1/1 rt slip next stitch to cable needle and place at front of work k tbl then place at back of work k
